page.title: 09Auction Market: Pateley
page.content: The Pateley Bridge Auction Market is held on Saturdays at 12.15pm and is begun by the ringing of a bell. It is run by the Sawley and District Farmers Auction Market Company. The market only deals with livestock which has been bred,reared and brought to market by the farmers themselves. These hardy animals, which have been reared on the hills of the dale,are bought by people from all over the country. The main sheep sales start in September and carry on through October. One sale of ewes and tups in October is known as the Hopper Sale. Cattle sales from January to August are fortnightly and then, from August to December, they are weekly. The selling goes on in a covered way, in the centre of the market, where the auctioneer calls out the bids. Cattle sold for up to Â£400 each, on June 22nd.
